turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: All right people. New plan. Not even a new plan so much as a modification of the old plan.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: So help me God you touch that phone and I bury you with them.  Surrender is no longer an option. I repeat - It is not an option. Is there anyone who does not understand that?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: That is a load of shit. Personal power has nothing to do with any of this. Tony Robbins has helped me to unlock energy and see my options more clearly, yes, but to give him credit for this, for all of this...Well that's just more than the man deserves.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I think we should say some words over the grave.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Micheal, now is probably not the best time for this.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: No, this is the perfect time. This is real time. Adam. Your brother and I, as well as several others present, have always suspected that you...  ...are a fully repressed, living in major denial, locked down, fly-boy butt-fucker.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: It goes; "Today is the first day of the rest of our lives."

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: However it goes, the point is, nobody says anything to anyone ever. Right? ...Right?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Fisher had a less than normal relationship with that Donkey.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: You always were a jealous man.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: The problem was our quarterback had trouble remembering his right from left...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No, the problem, as I recall, was the lack of blocking...

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: OK. Definitely not cool! Definitely inappropriate behavior here.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Negative. This is not what we have worked out in terms of presented behavior.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: No easy Boyd! I got a best friend in there in pieces. How about a little sensitivity?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: What is the question you asked me?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I said, what have we done?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Yes, you did. Now that is the question! That is exactly the question we should be asking ourselves. You tell me Fisher. What have we done?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I don't know! I just want to get married.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: What you just said. Say it again.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I just want to get married.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You want to know what you are doing here?! You are love pumping. You are protecting all that is sacred and beautiful and in sync with poetry and sunsets and little newborn babies. You are walking the walk. This is it Fisher, the real stuff. You love this woman. Love is second to nothing. I love you. I love Moore. I love Micheal. This car is full of love, and nothing - absolutely nothing - supersedes love, man. Nothing. We will do what it takes. Whatever it takes.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Does she sound pissed, scared, hostile? Did she mention the police?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No, but she's definitely pissed and hostile. And she's clearly starting to think that's something's not right.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Jesus Boyd you're going to O.D. him.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: After you drop the kids off, take Micheal home. Put a few drinks in him so he'll sleep.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I don't think that's such a good idea.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: And what does that mean?  Are you insane?!  You think I would hurt Lois?! She's the mother of those kids! What is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You got a nasty side to your thought process.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Okay. Here's the deal and it's a good one. Lois is cool. It's a pacified situation.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I'm talking about Lois having relaxed her anxiety. Only deal is...you still got Micheal there?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Good deal. Lois just wants to hear it from Micheal.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: That it was all an accident. She wants to hear it from Micheal's mouth.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Hold on a sec.  Lois, you sure you wouldn't rather do this in the morning?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: This is a situation that defies judgement. We have acted and showed courage that is not of a kind known by most.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm getting really tired of your bullshit.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: You've got a warped thought process. Your brain doesn't function properly.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You care to add a little specification to that slanderous accusation?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm talking about some bad, bad, very bad things. Bad things! Those are bad fucking things!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I'm serious. I'm the serious one here. I'm the one making the play. I'm the Indian Runner. And I want my money.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Blood money. Insurance dollars that you have thus fucking far decided not to tell me about at all. In no way have you mentioned that money. And I find that to be very very offensive.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: And if you think you can fuck me, don't. Cause I'm fucking insulated Fisher. Protected. Backed up on floppy. Do you get me? I want my fucking money!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I'm a lifesaver. A lighthouse. Up all night in the rain, in stormy gale force wind, tornado and fucking earthquakes. I stay lit for you. I stay lit. I don't go dark. I never go dark!

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You said one in two marriages end in divorce.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I am a lover. In Africa, you can stay king as long as you can service your women every night.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: And what happens when you can't?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: If I'm the king of Israel, I say to myself, King, I say to myself, King... Take a good look around. What do I see?

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: They have a president. A Benjamin Yahoo something.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I say to myself, look at the map. Look what's all around you. People who wish bad bad things for you and your people. For thousands of years the Jews are fighting everybody. It used to be they'd throw rocks, then the iron revolution and they would attack with spears. Then the gunpowder revolution. Now they're shooting fire power back and forth, all day bullets flying, babies getting shot.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Now if I'm the King of Israel and all these sand niggers are armed to the gills and you know it's just a matter of time ...right? Am I right?

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: The Israelis can protect themselves. They got the Mossad thing happening. Mossad's for real, man. They scalp babies.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Lock up the chickens, dig up the holy dirt, pack up the wailing crying wall thing they bang their heads on all day long, stick it all on a big fucking tug boat. The whole country picks up and takes Mexico.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: The Mexicans would love it. They're dying for a little order down there. They need direction.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: That's what I'm saying. Let the Israelis straighten it up. They got plenty of room down there, number one. Plus, and this is just a plus, they kind of look alike - the Jews and the Mexicans. So I think on a whole your average Joe Mexican is gonna have less of a problem getting his head around the whole assimilation thing. Am I right?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: A little gut check time fellas. A time for some serious self-exploration. How do I function? For real? No more bullshit. Can I keep my cool when they bounce my bananas? When they won't play my fucking song? etc, etc. Do you get me? Do you get me?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Not a problem. Understand not my words, but follow my orders. Follow my orders.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Oh that's just nothing. That's just a missing persons thing, that's all.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You said nobody would miss her.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: No. I said nobody knew she was coming to the hotel.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: This is going to stop right now. Right now!

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You will not screw this up.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: The need to know is clear. What did Adam tell Lois? That's the name of the game. What did Adam tell Lois? What does Lois know?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You want some breakfast meat. Micheal. Is that what you want?

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Franco Harris has a flare for the dramatic. The former Pittsburgh Steeler running back, beat known for "The Immaculate Reception," his improbable sixty yard Ricochet Reception. I say Ricochet Reception has made a bold move on corporate America.  Harris has lead a group of investors in the purchase of the Park Sausage Company. By taking on the challenge of resurrecting Park's, Harris is engaged in the equivalent of a sudden death overtime.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: He must take an open-field run to profitability through excessive debt large competitors and dwindling market share. Before the clock runs out.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Micheal get a grip.  What did you tell her?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Okay Micheal, let's go.  Upsy daisy big guy.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Come on tough guy. Listen to me.  You are going to tell Lois that it was all an accident. Okay cowboy? You got me?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Yea...It's great...seems like...I don't know you've got all the important stuff in there.

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: All right then. It's refreshing to see two young people not afraid of real commitment. Will you have friends or family saying words - singing or anything?

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: It's not a question of supposed to, it's an entirely personal decision... Some do some don't.

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: May we have the rings please?

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: These rings represent the commitment Fisher and Liz make to each other on the day. Fisher do you take Liz to be your beloved wife, to respect, honor and cherish till death do you part?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why can't we do it through the mail?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Can't we do it on the phone?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why is this Kid staring at me?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Did you send in all of the deposit checks?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What do you mean, you think so?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I sent a lot of checks, I'm not sure what all of them are.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hotel for my parents, the tent, the band, the Judge...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I think I forgot the tent.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why did you forget the tent check?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I didn't mean to Liz. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You can't play around with these tent people.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm not playing around. I forgot.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: How could I know what else I forgot?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I'm working my ass off here. I've taken care of absolutely everything Keith.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Because you wanted to. You wanted this to be your wedding not your parent's.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Don't you put this on me. Don't do it, don't do it, don't do it, don't...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You know how important this is to my mother. You know that.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry I forgot the tent. I don't think I forgot anything else.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I bet you didn't forget the bachelor party checks.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Are we going to do this again?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I'm just saying I bet those checks all found the mailboxes.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: It amazes me how organized you and your little fun bunch can be when it comes time to mobilize to Vegas.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: They organized this, not me. I have nothing to do with it.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: It's a bachelor party. You sort of have to do it before the wedding.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I suppose Boyd is the creative force behind all this.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: He's my friend. He's not a moron.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: David Boyd is a big sack of hot gas.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Why do you feel the need to explore this side of your personality?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I'm talking about the kind of people you hang out with...about growing up, assuming responsibility of yourself.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I asked you to marry me. I'm ready for marriage. That's responsibility. That's growth.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I just think that at some point you're going to have to re-evaluate some of your friendships...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: You don't like Moore? Since when?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: It's not that I don't like him. But the wedding has really got me thinking and... I just keep myself opening up. Crowning. And I want you keeping up with me here.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: What does Moore have to do with your growing?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I just don't see him in the big picture.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I've known him since Cub Scouts.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: He just doesn't talk a lot.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: He's weird. And I expect more from you.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You're going to be hungover for three days. Like those guys on "Oprah" that get drunk and have disgusting sex with prostitutes and then say their vows with the stench of cheap hotel whore sex all over them.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm not going to marry you with the smell of prostitutes on my body.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I am not common Keith. I am not common. I am a creature like no other and I will not be commoned! Is that to much to ask?  Is that to much to ask!?!

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: We're supposed to have gold-trimmed padded seats, now they're telling me that there was a mistake and we can't have padded.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: What kind of seats can we have?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Go down to the seat place and straighten this out.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Honey I don't have the time...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'll call them from the road.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: More than I ever imagined being able to love anyone ever.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: We're leaving from Adam's. Come send me off.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Will you please call the chair people?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Just call and let me know that your okay.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hi.  Are you calling from jail?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Well, the night is young. Did you straighten out the chair situation?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm working on it, I've made three calls.  I can't stop thinking about how much I love you.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Go have fun. Not too much.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: We're on our way home. I just...we're running a little late.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No. Just like an hour or so.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I left a message. I think it's going to be okay.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You sound funny. Did you do cocaine?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No. No. I'll see you in about four hours.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What's the word on the chairs?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Then you'd better work on it in the car. We gotta go see the Judge.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: "Darli...ing you, ewe ewe ewe, send me, Darli...ing you, ewe ewe ewe, mend me.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: "At first I thought it was infatuation ...But oh it's lasted so long..."

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: After the wedding, which we're paying for ourselves, and this house...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Well, can you come back inside?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Yeah. Look honey, I'll be right in. I just...we're just taking care of some Groomsmen last minute business.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Everything's OK. Just some more preparations.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No baby. We'll all be right in.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Cancel?! Cancel?! Are you out of your fucking mind?!

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Nobody's saying cancel. I'm talking about modifying.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Can we just talk this out?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Talk what out? We are locked and loaded here. We are non-refundable. I've got relatives on the airport right now! I've got...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Lois is a mess and Micheal's really upset. Everyone's upset.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No one's discussing it. I'm just gonna run Micheal home. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I need you to pick up the cake tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Don't we already have someone to do that for us?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: That means we get five hundred thousand to help raise the kids.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: It's okay...It's okay baby. Cry for Mama. Cry for Mama.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No it's not okay. It's not.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Cry for Boom Boom. It's okay.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Liz we've got to cancel, we have to put it off.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: What kind of stupid question is that?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Oh God. We. Liz. We. We. Killed a woman. We...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Oh Liz. We. God. We, in Vegas. Micheal crushed her skull. She was dead. There was nothing else to do. It was an accident.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No Micheal did. It was an accident.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: My God. You've got to call the police, tell them it was an accident. Where is she?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: She's in the desert. She's out in the desert.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You left a dead prostitute out in the desert? Alone?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: She's not alone...She's...Boyd...Oh God...He's gone nuts...He killed Lois and Micheal...it's all...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Stop! You stop right here. I don't want to know anymore. I told you not to do this Bachelor Party thing. You were warned.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: No buts. I told you your friends were Jackasses.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: No buts. I've waited twenty-seven years, twenty-seven years I have focused and prepared to walk down that aisle. I will not be derailed! I will not be embarrassed! I will not be denied! I am walking down that aisle tomorrow come hell or high fucking water!

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I told Boyd two fucking minutes!

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: He kept saying he was protected.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Like if something happened to him, he could still get us.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I don't know. He could have told someone. He could have, like in the event of his death, somehow let someone know where those bodies are buried.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: The only proof is those bodies.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I...Liz...all I ever wanted, was for you to be happy. I just wanted to give you the wedding, the life you always dreamed of...  ...I just love you so much...So much...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You and Moore move the bodies and bury Boyd with them. In fact, put Moore in the ground too.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: If you don't tie up all the loose ends it'll never be over.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You put him down or don't bother coming back.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Do you love me? DO YOU LOVE ME?!

turns.speaker: MR. FISHER
turns.text: I wanted to just take this final opportunity to visit with you. You know, just to be with you, father and son, before you run off and do your own husband, daddy thing.  I'm just so Goddamn proud of you...God knows I didn't always play it right with you...

turns.speaker: MR. FISHER
turns.text: I could have done it better. I'm a fucking ball-buster I am.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: You never walked away dad. You could have walked away.

turns.speaker: MR. FISHER
turns.text: I'm just so scared of that song. That fucking, "My son just arrived the other day...he says thanks for the ball, come on let's play. I got lots of bills come again next day. He's grown up just like me...My boy is just like me." Gordon fucking Lightfoot, Cat Stevens, whoever, that song just fucking kills me.

turns.speaker: MR. FISHER
turns.text: I love you so much it hurts. Me and your mother marvel at what you have become. You're going to have a wonderful journey with this girl. I feel it deep inside. A wonderful, magical journey.  And I'm, like I said, just so proud of how you turned out.  You go out and knock 'em dead Keith. Knock'em dead!

turns.speaker: MR. FISHER
turns.text: Well, I'm in the middle of my Goddamn toast here.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: OK, OK. You guys just go back in. Dad, keep going with the toast, we'll be right in. Go on.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I don't know. She's really been stressing out.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Just insecurity. Nut crunching gut splinters.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Mike Brenn. Yes. Yes. 14.3 at 7.5 for 6. At 29.83 at 9.  I'm amazed the windows don't blow out of their fucking sockets with all the repressed, ass-puckering rage in these soul-less lizards.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I just want her to be happy.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Same alarm clock every morning, same two pops on the same snooze button...  Micheal Brenn. Yes...Yes...  Hold your horses. Okay. Got it. 6.321 at 17.28 for 6.6 at 9.256 out at 3432.343.  Same shower, towel, toothbrush, razor, hair gel. It's a fucking epidemic Fisher and you better start addressing it. You're getting married and I'm not going to candy-coat it. It just gets worse. It's an eighteen wheel cement mixer that will crush every bone in your body.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Lately I'll just start getting lightheaded, dizzy, and I realize I haven't breathed in like two minutes.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Dear God...I don't know how to pray.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Just go ahead and say what's on your mind.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Yeah. I got some kind of buzzing. Like a zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz thing just chipping away in the back of my skull.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Yeah, well, it's a nasty problem.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Dad used to bring home these sparklers to me and Adam. Out back we'd light 'em up. The three of us. We'd hold 'em up to the sky and watch the explosions of light. Sparks. And dad would be all... "Get ready"..."watch for it"..."here it comes," here comes the "wahoo".

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: The sparkler would burn hot, then hotter, then even hotter...and there would be one moment of pure burn when that little fucker would cook just perfect. Perfect. It would only last a second, but that second was it. It was it. That's what dad had us looking for...You get me?

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: That's my point! You see Man...burning at his absolute. To see all the forces just come together, just right, you know, just in perfect harmony. That's what I'm driving at. You get me?

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: I've been looking for that flash and I look and I look and I can't find it. And what if I already had it? You know. My moment? What if it's gone? And I never saw it?  You're getting married, man. That's a fucking beautiful thing. Just a beautiful thing. I just can't stop breaking beautiful things.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I appreciate it. I do, but...Maybe you ought to just ease up om yourself a bit.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: No. No. No. This is my doing. You see I'm gonna have my wahoo spark for my own. For Lois and the kids, for my brother, for Franco. I'm gonna turn myself in. I am all that. I'm gonna do it for sweet Lois.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: If I was to think...If I were to think... No I mean I have thinked it over...I have. And without putting a lot of pressure on you I just...Well I just...

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Well if you do think about names... Micheal's a pretty good one...It's done me all right.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: That ought to be about the end of that.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: How do you know she's dead.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: Boyd...I don't know man...It just seems to me that ever since you took Tony Robbins self-help thing...you're all fucked-up in the head.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I got to agree with that.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I told her that I have no idea what Adam was talking about in that letter.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: You can tell when people believe you. It's obvious.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Well I don't have that skill and if I had to guess I would say that in no way did she believe me.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: I'm thinking about maybe making a move.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: Maybe go up to the North Pole, the Arctic. Tag polar bears with dart guns. I've always had a pretty good aim...

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: He came to me early today, was talking about money, insurance money. Said he was gonna get what was his.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: He said he was the Brain Trust. Said he was smarter than all of us. He started reading "Atlas Shrugged," staring at himself in the mirror.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Did he try to kiss you?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Yeah. I'm thinking about Micheal's Franco Harris fixation. You know how Micheal was always harping "Immaculate Reception?" I've seen that play. A lot of times...and I have to say this... Franco was lucky. Flat out, right place, right time. That's it. He was where the ball bounced. You get me?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I'm saying it's luck. All luck. You work your entire life, all the training, focus, all the dedication, all irrelevant. Where does the ball bounce? My father spent his whole life trying to start a company, practiced every day, worked like a dog, finally got enough money. He's paid the dues, he's ready, does all the market research, picks his shot - "Pup Corn."

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: That's right, "Pup Corn." Doggie treats. Little snacks for dogs. He's figured it out. There is a hole in the market and he's going to fill it. Spends all our money, works himself into not two but three heart attacks getting this shit up. After fifteen months, the big day arrives, the first box of "Pup Corn" pops off the belt. He comes running home with that box, pulls us out of school. We all pile into the living room, must be fifty of us, and in comes "Shelmer," our 8 year old mutt. "Here Shelmer," my dad cries. He's got that little fucking pup corn in his hand, "Here girl." This dog will eat anything, she eats rocks, anything. She walk's up to my dad's hand, looks down at the little pellet, licks it once, turns around, walks out of the room. Shelmer rejected the "Pup Corn." Fifteen months of my dad's life, right there. Not one dog ate Pup Corn. Not one. Three months later, "Pup Corn" shuts down. Chapter Eleven. My father never got over it. Never.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: I think there's a lot of truth in that. I'm gonna pursue some options. I want to join that Big Brother thing.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: I want a black one. A little black brother. That's a big problem it seems to me. Lack of racial integration. That's a big one. You think?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: I think you'd make an excellent Big Brother.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: Well that ought to be about the end of that.

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: We don't say "love, honor and obey" anymore. And we don't say "till death do us part." Today we say, "respect, honor and cherish, as long as you both do love." How does that sound?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I kind of like "till death do us part." I mean, this is forever. In sickness and in health, through good times and bad. Honey, what do you think?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: We don't think so. I mean, we just want the singing when I come out.

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: Okay great. What will that be?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: We're just going to have the leader of the band sing alone with his guitar. Acoustic.

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: Oh I know that. How does it go...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: You know,  Darling you...you send me...Darling you ...You mend me.  Honey, sing it for Judge Tower.

turns.speaker: JUDGE TOWER
turns.text: Liz do you take Fisher to be your beloved husband, to respect, honor and cherish him till death do you part?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: ...We will compare these before photos with whatever form of degeneration presented to us in 24 hours, no matter how low, how vile...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: ...regression of Modern Man to his most primitive, ape-like state...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I love it. I just love, love, love, love it.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Are you guys gonna fill this place with kids? You sure got room for them.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: We're in no hurry. I think we'll take some time to enjoy each other, enjoy our freedom before we surrender ourselves to kids.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Take your time. I wish I had.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: So where to on the honeymoon?

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Smart. Smart. Smart. Think big picture, take your time. I wish I had.

turns.speaker: MAGGIE
turns.text: Well, I just need your signature on these contracts and a deposit check so I can get the ball rolling.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Fish, I'm really sorry. I just...I owe you man.  Desert.
